title.text: Information structure and pauses in a corpus of spoken Danish

abstractContent.text: This paper describes a study in which a corpus of spoken Danish annotated with focus and topic tags was used to investigate the relation between information structure and pauses.

The results show that intra-clausal pauses in the focus domain , tend to precede those words that express the property or semantic type whereby the object in focus is distinguished from other ones in the domain.
